Description: Lower body and conical foot sherd of Chian, possibly early patterned or Wild Goat Style, pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black in bowl with trace of reserved dot in centre; exterior: reserved on bowl and top of foot; glazed streaky black around foot; inscription on underside.
Curator's comments: The number in Petrie's catalogue, '37', is written in pencil on the underside of the foot.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXII, no. 37)
Johnston 2006a / Trademarks on Greek Vases: Addenda (p. 170, no. 4)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0310) (phase 2)
